item.title: Read the ESA's new guidance for storefront accessibility tags
item.content:encoded:
Image via The Entertainment Software Association.

Newsbrief: The Entertainment Software Association is rolling out new guidance for developers making use of the storefront tags defines by the Accessible Games Initiative.

The guidance—released earlier this week—helps standardize how tags created by the initiative are displayed across different storefronts. This practice can help players seeking information on a game's accessibility options quickly determine if they're able to play your game.

You can review the guidance here.
